These sophisticated all-in-one appliances represent significant investments in your home's laundry capabilities, and when performance issues develop, finding qualified repair specialists becomes crucial for protecting both your investment and your household's efficiency.
Sears Home Services brings specialized expertise to LG washer dryer combo repairs, with technicians specifically trained on these technologically advanced units. Their in-depth knowledge often determines whether you'll face a straightforward repair or a costly replacement.
Recognizing Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Issues
Most combo units exhibit specific warning signs before developing serious functional problems. Identifying these early indicators can prevent more extensive damage:


Incomplete washing or drying cycles


Error codes appearing on the digital display


Unusual noises during operation (knocking, grinding, or buzzing)


Water leaking from the unit


Excessive vibration during spin cycles


Clothes remaining damp after complete cycles


Door locking mechanism failures


Problems switching between wash and dry functions


Draining issues or standing water in the drum


Unexpected increases in cycle duration


These symptoms typically indicate specific components requiring professional assessment. While basic troubleshooting might temporarily address surface issues, professional diagnosis and washer dryer combo repair service generally provides more effective, lasting solutions.
When to Call for Professional LG Washer Dryer Combo Service
While certain maintenance tasks like cleaning filters are suitable for homeowners, most internal problems require professional appliance repair attention. Generally speaking, you should contact qualified technicians when:


Basic troubleshooting steps from your owner's manual haven't resolved the issue


The unit displays error codes you cannot interpret


Water leakage occurs that you cannot easily trace or resolve


Unusual noises develop during operation


Electrical issues arise (tripping breakers, damaged cords)


The appliance remains under warranty protection (DIY repairs typically void coverage)


Smart features or Wi-Fi connectivity malfunctions


Multiple functions show simultaneous problems


Sears Home Services technicians receive specialized training on LG appliances, giving them unique insight into your particular model's components and systems. This expertise enables more accurate diagnosis and effective repairs.
Understanding LG Washer Dryer Combo Technology
Modern LG combo units incorporate sophisticated technology requiring equally advanced service approaches:


Direct Drive Motor Technology for quiet, efficient performance


TurboWash™ systems for enhanced cleaning efficiency


TrueSteam™ technology for sanitizing and wrinkle removal


Ventless condensing drying systems eliminating the need for external venting


Smart Diagnosis™ features for troubleshooting assistance


Wi-Fi connectivity for remote monitoring and control


Advanced sensor systems for optimal water and energy usage


Specialized drum designs for effective washing and drying in a single unit


This technological sophistication delivers space-saving convenience when functioning correctly but introduces complexity that makes amateur repairs potentially hazardous.
Sears technicians receive ongoing education covering these advanced systems to stay current with LG's innovations. Trust Sears Home Services to provide you with the best service when your need LG appliance repair.
The Value of Expert LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair
Professional repair services provide several crucial advantages that DIY approaches simply cannot match:


Safety assurance: Trained specialists understand electrical and water system safety requirements


Diagnostic precision: Experienced professionals can identify specific malfunctions without costly guesswork


Genuine components: Access to factory-certified replacement parts designed for your exact model


Technical proficiency: Specialized training translates to faster repairs with minimal trial and error


Warranty protection: Professional service maintains your manufacturer's guarantee coverage


Preventative insights: Addressing primary issues helps prevent related secondary failures


Sears distinguishes itself through methodical diagnostic procedures. Rather than simply replacing parts hoping to resolve symptoms, their technicians employ systematic troubleshooting to identify the underlying cause of your LG combo unit's malfunction. This approach frequently reduces customer costs by addressing root problems instead of merely treating surface issues.
Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Needs
Through years of servicing these specialized appliances, Sears has developed expertise in addressing these common LG combo issues:


Direct Drive motor system repairs: When motor performance issues arise, technicians systematically evaluate the sophisticated direct drive system, which differs significantly from traditional belt-driven mechanisms.


Condensing drying system problems: When drying performance suffers, technicians comprehensively assess condensation systems, air flow paths, and moisture sensors to identify the precise cause of inefficiency.


Electronic control board troubleshooting: The advanced control systems in LG units require specialized diagnostic equipment to accurately address problems ranging from sensor malfunctions to programming issues.


Water and drainage system repairs: Technicians bring specialized tools to assess inlet valves, drain pumps, and seal integrity that affect multiple aspects of combo unit performance.


This specialized knowledge allows technicians to address challenging problems that often frustrate less experienced repair providers. When your LG washer/dryer combo acts up, depend on Sears Home Services to provide you with dependable appliance repair.
The Financial Advantage of Timely Repairs
When facing washer dryer combo malfunctions, many homeowners struggle with repair-versus-replace decisions. Brief indecision frequently leads to delayed service, potentially transforming manageable issues into major failures. Timely intervention from qualified professionals typically proves substantially more affordable than replacement.
Consider that replacing an electronic control board might cost $350-650, while addressing connection problems or software issues early could be resolved for significantly less. Similarly, promptly repairing seal components prevents the water damage that can occur when leaks persist unaddressed.
The financial benefits of repair become even clearer considering that new LG combo units typically range from $1,300-2,500+, while most standard repairs cost between $200-600. With proper maintenance and timely service, your LG washer dryer combo should provide 10-14 years of reliable performance—making quality repair investments financially prudent.
A Customer's LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Experience
When Michael and Sophia noticed their LG combo unit was displaying intermittent error codes and taking increasingly longer to dry clothes, they were concerned about the advanced appliance that was essential to their condominium lifestyle.
"We specifically chose an LG combo for its advanced features and space-saving design," Michael explained. "When it started displaying error codes and leaving clothes slightly damp, we knew we needed specialized expertise rather than risking damage through DIY attempts."
After reviewing the owner's manual and attempting basic troubleshooting without success, they scheduled washer dryer combo repair their online portal. The scheduling system provided a specific time window rather than requiring them to wait around all day.
The technician, Alicia, arrived promptly and demonstrated immediate familiarity with their specific LG model. "She asked detailed questions about exactly when we first noticed the error codes and performance changes," Sophia recalled. "She explained that these particular symptoms in LG combo units often indicate either sensor calibration issues or problems with the condensing drying system."
After connecting specialized diagnostic equipment and conducting comprehensive testing, Alicia identified that the main control board had developed a firmware issue affecting cycle transitions, while the condenser unit required specialized cleaning to restore optimal performance.
"What impressed us most was her knowledge of LG's specific technology," Michael noted. "She accessed diagnostic modes we didn't even know existed, and demonstrated exactly how the condensing drying system differs from conventional dryers, which helped us understand both the problem and how to prevent future issues."
The repair required both electronic reprogramming and mechanical maintenance, which Alicia completed that same day. The combo unit immediately returned to its original performance, with both washing and drying functions working correctly.
Maximizing Your LG Washer Dryer Combo's Performance
Sears technicians consistently share these professional recommendations for maintaining LG combo unit excellence:


Run monthly tub cleaning cycles with approved washing machine cleaner


Clean the lint filter after every complete cycle


Check and clean the drain pump filter according to your model's maintenance schedule


Use HE (High Efficiency) detergent specifically formulated for front-loading machines


Leave the door slightly open between uses to allow moisture to evaporate


Wipe door gaskets and seals regularly to prevent mildew and ensure proper closure


Avoid overloading, which strains both washing and drying functions


For Wi-Fi enabled models, ensure firmware remains updated


Consider annual professional appliance maintenance to catch developing issues early


Following these maintenance practices helps preserve your LG washer dryer combo's performance and efficiency while preventing many common issues.

Brand-specific expertise: Technicians with specialized training on LG's advanced laundry systems


Diagnostic technology: Professional equipment allows precise identification of complex issues


Genuine parts: Access to factory-approved replacement components


Service guarantee: Repairs backed by satisfaction guarantees


Nationwide coverage: Consistent service standards across locations


Flexible scheduling: Online booking with specific time windows


Preventative recommendations: Custom maintenance advice for your specific model

These sophisticated all-in-one appliances represent significant investments in your home's laundry capabilities, and when performance issues develop, finding qualified repair specialists becomes crucial for protecting both your investment and your household's efficiency.
Sears Home Services brings specialized expertise to LG washer dryer combo repairs, with technicians specifically trained on these technologically advanced units. Their in-depth knowledge often determines whether you'll face a straightforward repair or a costly replacement.
Recognizing Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Issues
Most combo units exhibit specific warning signs before developing serious functional problems. Identifying these early indicators can prevent more extensive damage:


Incomplete washing or drying cycles


Error codes appearing on the digital display


Unusual noises during operation (knocking, grinding, or buzzing)


Water leaking from the unit


Excessive vibration during spin cycles


Clothes remaining damp after complete cycles


Door locking mechanism failures


Problems switching between wash and dry functions


Draining issues or standing water in the drum


Unexpected increases in cycle duration


These symptoms typically indicate specific components requiring professional assessment. While basic troubleshooting might temporarily address surface issues, professional diagnosis and washer dryer combo repair service generally provides more effective, lasting solutions.
When to Call for Professional LG Washer Dryer Combo Service
While certain maintenance tasks like cleaning filters are suitable for homeowners, most internal problems require professional appliance repair attention. Generally speaking, you should contact qualified technicians when:


Basic troubleshooting steps from your owner's manual haven't resolved the issue


The unit displays error codes you cannot interpret


Water leakage occurs that you cannot easily trace or resolve


Unusual noises develop during operation


Electrical issues arise (tripping breakers, damaged cords)


The appliance remains under warranty protection (DIY repairs typically void coverage)


Smart features or Wi-Fi connectivity malfunctions


Multiple functions show simultaneous problems


Sears Home Services technicians receive specialized training on LG appliances, giving them unique insight into your particular model's components and systems. This expertise enables more accurate diagnosis and effective repairs.
Understanding LG Washer Dryer Combo Technology
Modern LG combo units incorporate sophisticated technology requiring equally advanced service approaches:


Direct Drive Motor Technology for quiet, efficient performance


TurboWash™ systems for enhanced cleaning efficiency


TrueSteam™ technology for sanitizing and wrinkle removal


Ventless condensing drying systems eliminating the need for external venting


Smart Diagnosis™ features for troubleshooting assistance


Wi-Fi connectivity for remote monitoring and control


Advanced sensor systems for optimal water and energy usage


Specialized drum designs for effective washing and drying in a single unit


This technological sophistication delivers space-saving convenience when functioning correctly but introduces complexity that makes amateur repairs potentially hazardous.
Sears technicians receive ongoing education covering these advanced systems to stay current with LG's innovations. Trust Sears Home Services to provide you with the best service when your need LG appliance repair.

Through years of servicing these specialized appliances, Sears has developed expertise in addressing these common LG combo issues:


Direct Drive motor system repairs: When motor performance issues arise, technicians systematically evaluate the sophisticated direct drive system, which differs significantly from traditional belt-driven mechanisms.


Condensing drying system problems: When drying performance suffers, technicians comprehensively assess condensation systems, air flow paths, and moisture sensors to identify the precise cause of inefficiency.


Electronic control board troubleshooting: The advanced control systems in LG units require specialized diagnostic equipment to accurately address problems ranging from sensor malfunctions to programming issues.


Water and drainage system repairs: Technicians bring specialized tools to assess inlet valves, drain pumps, and seal integrity that affect multiple aspects of combo unit performance.


This specialized knowledge allows technicians to address challenging problems that often frustrate less experienced repair providers. When your LG washer/dryer combo acts up, depend on Sears Home Services to provide you with dependable appliance repair.
The Financial Advantage of Timely Repairs
When facing washer dryer combo malfunctions, many homeowners struggle with repair-versus-replace decisions. Brief indecision frequently leads to delayed service, potentially transforming manageable issues into major failures. Timely intervention from qualified professionals typically proves substantially more affordable than replacement.
Consider that replacing an electronic control board might cost $350-650, while addressing connection problems or software issues early could be resolved for significantly less. Similarly, promptly repairing seal components prevents the water damage that can occur when leaks persist unaddressed.
The financial benefits of repair become even clearer considering that new LG combo units typically range from $1,300-2,500+, while most standard repairs cost between $200-600. With proper maintenance and timely service, your LG washer dryer combo should provide 10-14 years of reliable performance—making quality repair investments financially prudent.
A Customer's LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Experience
When Michael and Sophia noticed their LG combo unit was displaying intermittent error codes and taking increasingly longer to dry clothes, they were concerned about the advanced appliance that was essential to their condominium lifestyle.
"We specifically chose an LG combo for its advanced features and space-saving design," Michael explained. "When it started displaying error codes and leaving clothes slightly damp, we knew we needed specialized expertise rather than risking damage through DIY attempts."
After reviewing the owner's manual and attempting basic troubleshooting without success, they scheduled washer dryer combo repair their online portal. The scheduling system provided a specific time window rather than requiring them to wait around all day.
The technician, Alicia, arrived promptly and demonstrated immediate familiarity with their specific LG model. "She asked detailed questions about exactly when we first noticed the error codes and performance changes," Sophia recalled. "She explained that these particular symptoms in LG combo units often indicate either sensor calibration issues or problems with the condensing drying system."
After connecting specialized diagnostic equipment and conducting comprehensive testing, Alicia identified that the main control board had developed a firmware issue affecting cycle transitions, while the condenser unit required specialized cleaning to restore optimal performance.
"What impressed us most was her knowledge of LG's specific technology," Michael noted. "She accessed diagnostic modes we didn't even know existed, and demonstrated exactly how the condensing drying system differs from conventional dryers, which helped us understand both the problem and how to prevent future issues."
The repair required both electronic reprogramming and mechanical maintenance, which Alicia completed that same day. The combo unit immediately returned to its original performance, with both washing and drying functions working correctly.
Maximizing Your LG Washer Dryer Combo's Performance
Sears technicians consistently share these professional recommendations for maintaining LG combo unit excellence:


Run monthly tub cleaning cycles with approved washing machine cleaner


Clean the lint filter after every complete cycle


Check and clean the drain pump filter according to your model's maintenance schedule


Use HE (High Efficiency) detergent specifically formulated for front-loading machines


Leave the door slightly open between uses to allow moisture to evaporate


Wipe door gaskets and seals regularly to prevent mildew and ensure proper closure


Avoid overloading, which strains both washing and drying functions


For Wi-Fi enabled models, ensure firmware remains updated


Consider annual professional appliance maintenance to catch developing issues early


Following these maintenance practices helps preserve your LG washer dryer combo's performance and efficiency while preventing many common issues.

full_content.content: Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Needs

full_content.content: Through years of servicing these specialized appliances, Sears has developed expertise in addressing these common LG combo issues:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
Direct Drive motor system repairs: When motor performance issues arise, technicians systematically evaluate the sophisticated direct drive system, which differs significantly from traditional belt-driven mechanisms.


Condensing drying system problems: When drying performance suffers, technicians comprehensively assess condensation systems, air flow paths, and moisture sensors to identify the precise cause of inefficiency.


Electronic control board troubleshooting: The advanced control systems in LG units require specialized diagnostic equipment to accurately address problems ranging from sensor malfunctions to programming issues.


Water and drainage system repairs: Technicians bring specialized tools to assess inlet valves, drain pumps, and seal integrity that affect multiple aspects of combo unit performance.

full_content.content: The Financial Advantage of Timely Repairs
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: When facing washer dryer combo malfunctions, many homeowners struggle with repair-versus-replace decisions. Brief indecision frequently leads to delayed service, potentially transforming manageable issues into major failures. Timely intervention from qualified professionals typically proves substantially more affordable than replacement.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Consider that replacing an electronic control board might cost $350-650, while addressing connection problems or software issues early could be resolved for significantly less. Similarly, promptly repairing seal components prevents the water damage that can occur when leaks persist unaddressed.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: The financial benefits of repair become even clearer considering that new LG combo units typically range from $1,300-2,500+, while most standard repairs cost between $200-600. With proper maintenance and timely service, your LG washer dryer combo should provide 10-14 years of reliable performance—making quality repair investments financially prudent.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: A Customer's LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Experience
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: When Michael and Sophia noticed their LG combo unit was displaying intermittent error codes and taking increasingly longer to dry clothes, they were concerned about the advanced appliance that was essential to their condominium lifestyle.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: "We specifically chose an LG combo for its advanced features and space-saving design," Michael explained. "When it started displaying error codes and leaving clothes slightly damp, we knew we needed specialized expertise rather than risking damage through DIY attempts."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: After reviewing the owner's manual and attempting basic troubleshooting without success, they scheduled washer dryer combo repair their online portal. The scheduling system provided a specific time window rather than requiring them to wait around all day.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"washer dryer combo repair","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service"}

full_content.content: The technician, Alicia, arrived promptly and demonstrated immediate familiarity with their specific LG model. "She asked detailed questions about exactly when we first noticed the error codes and performance changes," Sophia recalled. "She explained that these particular symptoms in LG combo units often indicate either sensor calibration issues or problems with the condensing drying system."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: After connecting specialized diagnostic equipment and conducting comprehensive testing, Alicia identified that the main control board had developed a firmware issue affecting cycle transitions, while the condenser unit required specialized cleaning to restore optimal performance.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: "What impressed us most was her knowledge of LG's specific technology," Michael noted. "She accessed diagnostic modes we didn't even know existed, and demonstrated exactly how the condensing drying system differs from conventional dryers, which helped us understand both the problem and how to prevent future issues."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: The repair required both electronic reprogramming and mechanical maintenance, which Alicia completed that same day. The combo unit immediately returned to its original performance, with both washing and drying functions working correctly.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Maximizing Your LG Washer Dryer Combo's Performance
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: Sears technicians consistently share these professional recommendations for maintaining LG combo unit excellence:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
Run monthly tub cleaning cycles with approved washing machine cleaner


Clean the lint filter after every complete cycle


Check and clean the drain pump filter according to your model's maintenance schedule


Use HE (High Efficiency) detergent specifically formulated for front-loading machines


Leave the door slightly open between uses to allow moisture to evaporate


Wipe door gaskets and seals regularly to prevent mildew and ensure proper closure


Avoid overloading, which strains both washing and drying functions


For Wi-Fi enabled models, ensure firmware remains updated


Consider annual professional appliance maintenance to catch developing issues early

full_content.content: Glossary TermsWhat is the drum of the washing machine?The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.What is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

self.__next_f.push([1,"When your innovative LG washer dryer combo stops functioning properly, the impact extends far beyond simple inconvenience. These sophisticated all-in-one appliances represent significant investments in your home's laundry capabilities, and when performance issues develop, finding qualified repair specialists becomes crucial for protecting both your investment and your household's efficiency. 

Sears Home Services brings specialized expertise to LG washer dryer combo repairs, with technicians specifically trained on these technologically advanced units. Their in-depth knowledge often determines whether you'll face a straightforward repair or a costly replacement.  

## Recognizing Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Issues 

Most combo units exhibit specific warning signs before developing serious functional problems. Identifying these early indicators can prevent more extensive damage: 

* Incomplete washing or drying cycles 

* Error codes appearing on the digital display 

* Unusual noises during operation (knocking, grinding, or buzzing) 

* Water leaking from the unit 

* Excessive vibration during spin cycles 

* Clothes remaining damp after complete cycles 

* Door locking mechanism failures 

* Problems switching between wash and dry functions 

* Draining issues or standing water in the drum 

* Unexpected increases in cycle duration 

These symptoms typically indicate specific components requiring professional assessment. While basic troubleshooting might temporarily address surface issues, professional diagnosis and [washer dryer combo repair](/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service) service generally provides more effective, lasting solutions.  

## When to Call for Professional LG Washer Dryer Combo Service 

While certain maintenance tasks like cleaning filters are suitable for homeowners, most internal problems require professional [appliance repair](/repair) attention. Generally speaking, you should contact qualified technicians when: 

* Basic troubleshooting steps from your owner's manual haven't resolved the issue 

* The unit displays error codes you cannot interpret 

* Water leakage occurs that you cannot easily trace or resolve 

* Unusual noises develop during operation 

* Electrical issues arise (tripping breakers, damaged cords) 

* The appliance remains under warranty protection (DIY repairs typically void coverage) 

* Smart features or Wi-Fi connectivity malfunctions 

* Multiple functions show simultaneous problems 

Sears Home Services technicians receive specialized training on LG appliances, giving them unique insight into your particular model's components and systems. This expertise enables more accurate diagnosis and effective repairs. 

## Understanding LG Washer Dryer Combo Technology 

Modern LG combo units incorporate sophisticated technology requiring equally advanced service approaches: 

* **Direct Drive Motor Technology** for quiet, efficient performance 

* **TurboWash™** systems for enhanced cleaning efficiency 

* **TrueSteam™** technology for sanitizing and wrinkle removal 

* **Ventless condensing drying systems** eliminating the need for external venting 

* **Smart Diagnosis™** features for troubleshooting assistance 

* **Wi-Fi connectivity** for remote monitoring and control 

* **Advanced sensor systems** for optimal water and energy usage 

* **Specialized drum designs** for effective washing and drying in a single unit 

This technological sophistication delivers space-saving convenience when functioning correctly but introduces complexity that makes amateur repairs potentially hazardous.  

Sears technicians receive ongoing education covering these advanced systems to stay current with LG's innovations. Trust Sears Home Services to provide you with the best service when your need [LG appliance repair](/repair/lg). 

## The Value of Expert LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair 

Professional repair services provide several crucial advantages that DIY approaches simply cannot match: 

* **Safety assurance**: Trained specialists understand electrical and water system safety requirements 

* **Diagnostic precision**: Experienced professionals can identify specific malfunctions without costly guesswork 

* **Genuine components**: Access to factory-certified replacement parts designed for your exact model 

* **Technical proficiency**: Specialized training translates to faster repairs with minimal trial and error 

* **Warranty protection**: Professional service maintains your manufacturer's guarantee coverage 

* **Preventative insights**: Addressing primary issues helps prevent related secondary failures 

Sears distinguishes itself through methodical diagnostic procedures. Rather than simply replacing parts hoping to resolve symptoms, their technicians employ systematic troubleshooting to identify the underlying cause of your LG combo unit's malfunction. This approach frequently reduces customer costs by addressing root problems instead of merely treating surface issues.  

## Common LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Needs 

Through years of servicing these specialized appliances, Sears has developed expertise in addressing these common LG combo issues: 

* **Direct Drive motor system repairs**: When motor performance issues arise, technicians systematically evaluate the sophisticated direct drive system, which differs significantly from traditional belt-driven mechanisms. 

* **Condensing drying system problems**: When drying performance suffers, technicians comprehensively assess condensation systems, air flow paths, and moisture sensors to identify the precise cause of inefficiency. 

* **Electronic control board troubleshooting**: The advanced control systems in LG units require specialized diagnostic equipment to accurately address problems ranging from sensor malfunctions to programming issues. 

* **Water and drainage system repairs**: Technicians bring specialized tools to assess inlet valves, drain pumps, and seal integrity that affect multiple aspects of combo unit performance. 

This specialized knowledge allows technicians to address challenging problems that often frustrate less experienced repair providers. When your LG washer/dryer combo acts up, depend on Sears Home Services to provide you with dependable [appliance repair](/repair). 

## The Financial Advantage of Timely Repairs 

When facing washer dryer combo malfunctions, many homeowners struggle with repair-versus-replace decisions. Brief indecision frequently leads to delayed service, potentially transforming manageable issues into major failures. Timely intervention from qualified professionals typically proves substantially more affordable than replacement. 

Consider that replacing an electronic control board might cost $350-650, while addressing connection problems or software issues early could be resolved for significantly less. Similarly, promptly repairing seal components prevents the water damage that can occur when leaks persist unaddressed. 

The financial benefits of repair become even clearer considering that new LG combo units typically range from $1,300-2,500+, while most standard repairs cost between $200-600. With proper maintenance and timely service, your LG washer dryer combo should provide 10-14 years of reliable performance—making quality repair investments financially prudent.  

## A Customer's LG Washer Dryer Combo Repair Experience 

When Michael and Sophia noticed their LG combo unit was displaying intermittent error codes and taking increasingly longer to dry clothes, they were concerned about the advanced appliance that was essential to their condominium lifestyle. 

"We specifically chose an LG combo for its advanced features and space-saving design," Michael explained. "When it started displaying error codes and leaving clothes slightly damp, we knew we needed specialized expertise rather than risking damage through DIY attempts." 

After reviewing the owner's manual and attempting basic troubleshooting without success, they scheduled [washer dryer combo repair](/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service) their online portal. The scheduling system provided a specific time window rather than requiring them to wait around all day. 

The technician, Alicia, arrived promptly and demonstrated immediate familiarity with their specific LG model. "She asked detailed questions about exactly when we first noticed the error codes and performance changes," Sophia recalled. "She explained that these particular symptoms in LG combo units often indicate either sensor calibration issues or problems with the condensing drying system." 

After connecting specialized diagnostic equipment and conducting comprehensive testing, Alicia identified that the main control board had developed a firmware issue affecting cycle transitions, while the condenser unit required specialized cleaning to restore optimal performance. 

"What impressed us most was her knowledge of LG's specific technology," Michael noted. "She accessed diagnostic modes we didn't even know existed, and demonstrated exactly how the condensing drying system differs from conventional dryers, which helped us understand both the problem and how to prevent future issues." 

The repair required both electronic reprogramming and mechanical maintenance, which Alicia completed that same day. The combo unit immediately returned to its original performance, with both washing and drying functions working correctly.  

## Maximizing Your LG Washer Dryer Combo's Performance 

Sears technicians consistently share these professional recommendations for maintaining LG combo unit excellence: 

* Run monthly tub cleaning cycles with approved washing machine cleaner 

* Clean the lint filter after every complete cycle 

* Check and clean the drain pump filter according to your model's maintenance schedule 

* Use HE (High Efficiency) detergent specifically formulated for front-loading machines 

* Leave the door slightly open between uses to allow moisture to evaporate 

* Wipe door gaskets and seals regularly to prevent mildew and ensure proper closure 

* Avoid overloading, which strains both washing and drying functions 

* For Wi-Fi enabled models, ensure firmware remains updated 

* Consider annual professional [appliance maintenance](/maintain) to catch developing issues early 

Following these maintenance practices helps preserve your LG washer dryer combo's performance and efficiency while preventing many common issues.

self.__next_f.push([1,"## How They Work: All-in-One Washer Dryers Function and Features

All-in-one washer dryers combine the capabilities of both machines into one, making them a space-saving and efficient option for homes with limited laundry space. These appliances allow homeowners to wash and dry clothes in the same drum, simplifying the laundry process. They come in two types: **vented** and **ventless**. Vented units use a heating element to dry clothes in the same way as a traditional dryer, while ventless units use a condenser to remove moisture, offering a method for drying without the need for external venting.

### Key Components of All-in-One Washer Dryers

These machines are designed with several core parts that handle both washing and drying:

- **Drum**: The same drum is used for both washing and drying, eliminating the need to transfer clothes.
- **Detergent Dispenser**: Accurately disperses detergent during the wash cycle.
- **Water Inlet**: Brings in water for the washing phase.
- **Drain Pump**: Removes water after the rinse and spin cycles.
- **Heating Element or Condenser**: In vented models, the heating element warms the air for drying. In ventless models, the condenser extracts moisture without needing outside venting.

### Benefits of All-in-One Washer Dryer Combos

These appliances offer multiple advantages:

- **Space-Saving Design**: Combining two functions in one, they are perfect for homes with limited room for laundry appliances.
- **Convenience**: There’s no need to switch clothes between machines. Load them once, and the washer/dryer handles the entire process.
- **Customizable Cycles**: With various wash and dry settings, you can adjust cycles to suit different fabric types and load sizes. Some models even offer advanced features like steam cleaning for extra freshness.

---

![how do all in one washer dryers work-perfect for smaller spaces](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/1lBsNvUpzlpXEO0eUVvjIy/a6cc87fff28b6c5f1961e14850c00673/how_do_all_in_one_washer_dryers_work-perfect_for_smaller_spaces.png)

## Efficiency of All-in-One Washer Dryers

All-in-one washer dryers are designed to make laundry more convenient while using energy and water efficiently. These appliances incorporate advanced technology to balance performance and resource conservation, making them a solid option for those looking to save both time and energy.

### Energy Efficiency in All-in-One Washer Dryers

Modern all-in-one washer dryers come equipped with high-efficiency motors and sensors that adjust cycles based on load size and fabric type. These features help manage energy use by optimizing the washing and drying processes, which can lead to lower utility bills. In ventless models, moisture is removed through condensation, requiring less heat and contributing to overall energy savings.

### Water Usage in All-in-One Washer Dryers

Many of these appliances are designed to use minimal water without sacrificing cleaning power. Load-sensing technology controls the amount of water used, depending on the size of the laundry. Adjustable water levels also help maintain efficiency, reducing the risk of water waste during any part of the cycle.

### Time-Saving Features

By combining washing and drying into one appliance, all-in-one washer dryers save time by removing the need to transfer clothes between machines. Some models include features like quick wash and dry cycles, which can reduce laundry time even further. Other time-saving options, such as steam cleaning and wrinkle prevention, help make laundry day easier and faster.

---

## Pros and Cons of All-in-One Washer Dryers

When deciding whether an all-in-one washer dryer is the right fit for your home, it's important to weigh the benefits and potential trade-offs. These appliances offer the convenience of combining two functions in one, but like any major home appliance, they come with considerations that may affect how well they suit your laundry needs.

### Advantages of All-in-One Washer Dryers

- **Space-Saving**: These appliances are perfect for small living spaces, apartments, or homes with limited room for laundry equipment.
- **Convenience**: There’s no need to transfer clothes between machines. The washer dryer handles both tasks in one go, which can save time and effort.
- **Energy Efficiency**: Many models are designed to use less water and electricity than traditional setups, which can reduce utility costs and make them a more eco-friendly choice.

### Considerations for All-in-One Washer Dryers

- **Capacity**: The drum size in these units is usually smaller compared to separate washers and dryers, which means you may need to run more frequent loads. Be sure to choose one that fits your laundry needs.
- **Drying Time**: The drying process may take longer than a standalone dryer, especially with larger or heavier loads. The smaller drum and lower heat output can result in extended drying cycles, so it’s important to plan ahead.

### Limitations of All-in-One Washer Dryers

- **Performance**: While convenient, these units may not offer the same drying power as a separate dryer, particularly with bulkier items. Clothes might take longer to dry or may not dry as thoroughly.
- **Repairs and Maintenance**: If a malfunction occurs, it can be more complex to repair since both the washer and dryer functions are combined. This could lead to higher repair costs, and a failure in one part of the machine might affect both washing and drying capabilities.

---

## Maintenance and Care for All-in-One Washer Dryers

Maintaining an all-in-one washer dryer properly can help extend its lifespan and keep it running efficiently. By following regular cleaning and maintenance practices, you can avoid common issues and keep your appliance performing at its best.

### Routine Cleaning for Optimal Performance

Keeping your washer dryer clean plays a key role in maintaining efficiency. A few simple steps can make a big difference in the machine's overall performance:

- **Clean the Lint Filter**: After every drying cycle, remove any lint or debris from the filter to prevent blockages and improve drying efficiency.
- **Wipe Down the Interior**: Regularly clean the drum and door seal with a damp cloth to remove any dirt, detergent residue, or fabric softener buildup.
- **Run a Monthly Cleaning Cycle**: Using a washing machine cleaner once a month helps remove any buildup inside the machine that can affect its performance over time.

### Common Troubleshooting Tips

All-in-one washer dryers can experience issues from time to time. Here are a few common problems and how to address them:

- **Draining Issues**: If water isn’t draining properly, check for clogs in the drain hose or pump filter. Make sure the hose isn’t kinked or twisted, as this can disrupt the water flow.
- **Excessive Noise**: An unbalanced load can cause the machine to make excessive noise during operation. Redistribute the clothes evenly or reduce the load size to resolve this issue.
- **Drying Problems**: If the dryer isn’t working efficiently, check that the lint screen and exhaust vent are clear of obstructions. Clogged vents can increase drying times and reduce overall performance. If the issue persists, schedule [professional repair services](/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service) to address more complex problems.

### Extending the Lifespan of Your All-in-One Washer Dryer

Regular care and attention can help keep your appliance running smoothly for years to come:

- **Avoid Overloading**: Follow the manufacturer’s recommended load capacity to avoid putting strain on the motor and other key components.
- **Use the Right Products**: Choose detergents and fabric softeners specifically designed for your machine to prevent residue buildup that could interfere with performance.
- **Inspect Connections**: Regularly check hoses and electrical cords for any loose connections. Tightening these can prevent leaks and potential electrical issues.

For more in-depth care, consider scheduling [routine professional maintenance](/maintain) to keep your machine in top shape and avoid potential breakdowns.

---

![how do all in one washer dryers work-comparing the features](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/7Z7UkeMkB7QB8QplTS2da/1ba1f4c6e941020b64002066c6224ec1/how_do_all_in_one_washer_dryers_work-comparing_the_features.png)

## Factors to Consider for All-in-One Washer Dryers

When choosing an all-in-one washer dryer, several factors can guide you toward the best fit for your home. These appliances offer a variety of features, and understanding what to look for will help you find one that meets your specific laundry needs.

### Capacity and Space Requirements

The capacity of an all-in-one washer dryer is important, especially if your household manages frequent or large loads. While these units are designed to save space, their load size is typically smaller than that of separate machines. Consider how much laundry you regularly do and the available space in your home when selecting a model.

### Features and Technology

Many all-in-one washer dryers come with advanced features that add convenience to laundry tasks:

- **Custom Wash and Dry Cycles**: Different cycles for delicate fabrics, heavy-duty loads, and quick washes allow you to adjust settings based on your laundry needs.
- **Temperature Settings**: Adjustable temperature controls are available for both washing and drying.
- **Smart Capabilities**: Some models include Wi-Fi connectivity, enabling you to control and monitor the machine remotely through a smartphone app.

### Energy Efficiency

Energy efficiency is another important consideration. Choosing a model with a high energy efficiency rating can help reduce utility bills while also minimizing environmental impact.

### Maintenance and Repair Services

Regular maintenance is important to keep your all-in-one washer dryer running smoothly. Scheduling [routine professional maintenance](/maintain) can help extend the lifespan of your appliance and prevent potential breakdowns. If you do experience problems with your appliance, scheduling [professional repair services](/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service) may be necessary to fix more complex problems. 

---

All-in-one washer dryers streamline both washing and drying into a single, space-saving appliance, making them perfect for smaller homes or busy households. By using specialized sensors, these units monitor water levels, adjust temperatures, and optimize spin speeds to handle laundry from start to finish with minimal oversight. However, if you begin to notice longer cycle times, excessive noise, or leftover moisture after the drying phase, it may be time for a professional assessment. For help with any persistent performance issues, you can schedule [washer and dryer repair near me](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/washer-dryer-combo-repair-service) through Sears Home Services. Factory-trained technicians are prepared to diagnose and fix problems quickly, so you can continue enjoying the convenience of your all-in-one washer dryer without interruption.

---
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"In this article, we’ll describe how a garage door sensor works so you can effectively fix problems on your own and know when to call in professional [garage door opener repair](/repair) help.

## How Does a Garage Door Sensor Work?

A garage door opener safety sensor includes these components:

* Emitter module.
* Receiver module.
* Wiring that connects the modules to the logic board in the garage door opener motor unit.

The emitter and receiver modules are connected to the rails of the garage door with brackets. They’re positioned about 6-inches above the ground to detect foreign objects or obstructions in the path of the closing garage door to prevent injuries or damage to the garage door.

The emitter gets power from the logic board and wires. It sends an infrared beam of light from the emitter to the receiver module. If the receiver module doesn’t detect the infrared beam because the beam is blocked by a person or object while closing the garage door, the opener will reverse the direction of the door and open it back up. The lights will typically blink (often 10 times) when the sensors detect an obstruction between the infrared beams.

The garage door opener will also reverse the door and blink the lights if the emitter and receiver modules are misaligned and the receiver module isn’t detecting the infrared beam from the emitter module.

![how-to-align-the-garage-door-opener-safety-sensors](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/3WSCJlOWGLgzR7ZW3JvXrR/4dfe444efc9c4d59f2477479c68fa10c/aligning-a-garage-door-opener-safety-sensor-image.png)

## How to Align Garage Door Opener Safety Sensor

Lights on the emitter and receiver modules help you align the safety sensors so they work properly.

The emitter module typically has a yellow light that should be lit all of the time. The receiver module has a green light that turns on when the receiver detects the emitted infrared beam because the modules are aligned and unblocked by any obstructions.

When aligning the sensors, make sure the yellow emitter light is on and adjust the positions of the emitter and receiver modules until the green light turns on – indicating that the infrared beam is aligned.

## How to Tell When Something’s Wrong

The first key to knowing that something is wrong with the safety sensor is that the garage door won’t close using the opener. When you activate the garage door opener to shut the garage door, the door may begin to close and then reverse and move back to the fully open position. The lights on the garage door opener motor unit will often blink, indicating an obstruction in the safety sensor beam path or that the sensors aren’t aligned.

Remove the obstruction or realign the sensor in this situation.

If the door doesn’t move at all, the sensor may not be connected properly through the wires to the motor unit or the sensors may be defective. Wiring between the motor unit and the sensors or a bad logic board on the garage door opener could also be causing this failure.

## Troubleshooting Garage Door Sensor Problems

To troubleshoot this garage door opener problem, follow the expert tips in this popular video from Sears PartsDirect that has over 1 million views:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D1-jABFaOLU" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If you’re unable to find and fix the garage door opener failure on your own, schedule [garage door opener repair](/repair) service and we’ll send a technician to your home to diagnose the issue and get your garage door opener working again.

Sometimes, you may encounter an intermittent problem with the garage door opener sensors – especially on clear winter days when sunlight reflects off snow and ice to interfere with the infrared sensing beams. When you suspect this type of problem is preventing the garage door from closing properly, install garage door opener sun shields as shown in this helpful video:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iFJd5n6MEX0" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

## Maintaining Your Garage Door and Opener

Keeping your garage door and its opener well-maintained are key to their smooth operation. Problems with the door can jostle the safety sensors out of alignment or cause wiring problems. Checking the garage door opener regularly will ensure its safe operation.

### Garage Door Maintenance

Here's a handy garage door maintenance checklist:

* __Inspect and clean the garage door tracks:__ Begin by visually inspecting the tracks for signs of wear or damage. Clean any dirt or debris to ensure smooth operation and prevent the door from jamming.
* __Lubricate moving parts:__ Use a silicone-based lubricant to reduce friction and ensure smooth operation of hinges, rollers, and springs. Wipe off any excess lubricant to prevent accumulation of dirt and debris.
* __Check garage door springs:__ Garage door springs play a crucial role in balancing the door weight. Inspect them for signs of damage like rust or fraying. If you find any issues, it's best to seek professional help for spring adjustments or replacements.
* __Inspect the garage door lock:__ Test the garage door lock operation. Lubricate parts if necessary. Replace any worn or broken parts. You’ll rarely use the garage door lock when you have a garage door opener installed, but you want to be sure it works if and when you do need it.

### Garage Door Opener Maintenance

Here are essential tips to help keep your garage door opener well-maintained and working safely:

* __Test the safety sensors:__ Ensure that safety features like sensors and the auto-reverse function are working correctly. You can test the safety sensors by placing an object in the door's path and ensuring the door reverses and goes back up when you activate the garage door opener to close the door. If these features are malfunctioning, troubleshoot the problem as discussed above or contact a [garage door opener repair](/repair) professional.
* __Check the auto-reverse function:__ To test the auto-reverse safety function of your garage door opener, you can: 
     * Make sure the garage door is fully open.
     * Place a 1.5 inch thick board or a 2x4 on the floor in the center of the garage door .
     * Press the remote or wall button to close the door.
     * The door should stop and reverse when it hits the board. If not, adjust the downforce setting as described below or have the garage door opener repaired or replaced by a professional.
* __Check the garage door opener downforce setting:__ Some garage door openers use small dials on the motor unit to control the downforce when closing the garage door. Make sure that the downforce is not set too high. Excessive downforce is dangerous and can cause property damage or injury to anything caught in the path of door. Close the door with the opener and carefully grab it with your hand when the door is halfway down to make sure that the downforce isn't excessive. If you can stop the door using your hand, then no further adjustment is necessary. If you’re unable to stop the door with your hand, reduce the downforce in small increments. Make adjustments until the door closes completely on its own but will still stop if you catch it halfway down. Here’s a YouTube video that illustrates how to adjust force settings on common garage door openers:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WI-vVCS-0jo" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If your garage door opener has a battery backup, test the battery. To test the battery, unplug the garage door opener; the battery status LED light should glow solid orange, indicating the opener is running on battery power. If the LED light flashes, that means it’s time to replace the battery because the battery power is low.

Maintenance and safety checks for your model of garage door opener may differ from the procedures described above. Check your owner’s manual for information about maintenance specific to your garage door opener.

Regular [garage door maintenance](https://www.searsgaragedoors.com/repairs) not only extends your garage door's lifespan and keeps it operating safely, but also helps avoid unexpected breakdowns.

self.__next_f.push([1,"![turn-off-the-refrigerator-dispenser-child-lock](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/59mQHo6jZj2q78AdkoIhxa/322748bb521d647fce838949e25ce16f/refrigerator-dispenser-locked-image.png)

## Turn Off the Dispenser Child Lock

Check to see if the child lock feature on the dispenser is turned on. If it is, the water and ice dispenser  won’t work.

Turn the child lock feature off if you find it enabled. For most fridges, you’ll need to press and hold the dispenser button marked with the lock icon label for 5 seconds.

After turning off the child lock, the water dispenser (and ice dispenser) should work again.

---

![check-for-frozen-water-reservoir](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/7KhNA6qVX7vP2RgIoCBxEz/db674e7c187f3419243d902b5c63d7b6/refrigerator-water-dispenser-reservoir.png)

## Check for a Frozen Water Supply Line or Frozen Water Reservoir

In the back of some refrigerator compartments, behind the crisper drawers, you’ll find a water reservoir or coiled up section of water tubing that cools down water for the water dispenser.

A frozen line or frozen reservoir can prevent the water dispenser from getting water. Check for a frozen water line or reservoir and thaw the freeze using a hair dryer on a low heat setting.

This tactic may fix the water dispenser.

---

## Check the Water Supply

Check to see if the ice maker is getting water. Empty the ice bin into a container and store that ice in the freezer. Once the ice maker cycles a dumps a batch of ice, see if the ice mold is filled with water to make a new batch of ice or see if the ice maker dumps a second batch of ice.

If the ice maker is getting water and making ice, then you know that the water supply going to the refrigerator is okay.

If the ice maker isn’t getting water, replace the water filter if you haven’t replaced it within the last 6 months. This may restore the water supply.

If the water filter isn’t the problem, check the water supply going to the fridge using this procedure:

1. Shut off the water supply cut-off valve for the refrigerator.
2. Disconnect the water supply line from the back of the refrigerator.
3. Place the end of the water supply line in a bucket and briefly open the water supply cut-off valve.

If water doesn’t flow from the end of the water line, have a plumber fix the water supply going to the refrigerator.

If water flows from the end of the water supply line, then you know that the house water supply for the refrigerator is okay.

---

![check-the-refrigerator-water-valve](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/28QaHepQAqYgtpv9aLunf6/8934882ce37114d2e18b66d4b12ae4b4/replacing-the-refrigerator-inlet-water-valve.png)

## Examine the Inlet Water Valve

If the water supply going to the refrigerator is okay, then __unplug the fridge__ and check the wire harness connection on the inlet water valve.

Reconnect the inlet water valve wires if you find them loose or disconnected.

If the wire harness connection is okay, then a bad water inlet valve could be preventing the water dispenser and ice maker from getting water. Other failures such as a damaged internal wire or bad control component could keep the water inlet valve from working. 

Schedule [refrigerator repair](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service) service to have a technician check the water valve circuit. The tech will need to conduct a live voltage check to see if the valve is getting voltage when you press the dispenser lever. If the valve is getting voltage but not opening to supply water to the water dispenser and ice maker, then the technician will replace the water inlet valve.

If you suspect that the water valve is defective and you want to replace it yourself without further diagnosis, follow the steps in this video to install a new water inlet valve:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tU4UK2ELxOM" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Replacing the inlet water valve without a full diagnosis of the problem is a risk but it may fix the water dispenser failure.

---

![disassembled-water-dispenser](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/I1NwsyW8DCZeU6v1k93vO/38da94c94c6128014b0d7cd5a25714b8/disassembled-refrigerator-dispenser.png)

## Water Dispenser Control Problems

A failed micro-switch or bad dispenser control board can prevent the water dispenser working.

When the troubleshooting steps outlined above don’t help you fix a water dispenser failure, schedule [refrigerator repair](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service) service to inspect the dispenser components and find the cause of the failure.

## How to know if your refrigerator water valve is bad

A service technician will check to see if the valve is getting electrical current when actuated. If the valve coil is getting current but doesn’t open, the technician will replace the water valve. This type of live voltage check isn’t safe for DIY’ers. To check the water inlet valve on your own, unplug the refrigerator and check the resistance through the water valve solenoid coil using a multimeter. The meter should typically measure 200 to 500 ohms of resistance if it’s good. If the meter measures infinite resistance, replace the water valve because it is bad.

### Cost to replace a water inlet valve on a refrigerator

If you can replace the water inlet valve yourself, then all that you’ll spend is the price of the replacement part – typically between $20 and $100. If you need to have a service technician replace the valve, that repair will typically cost you between $150 and $300.

### Life expectancy of a water valve

Refrigerator water valves typically last 15 to 20 years but a failure in this type of device can occur at any time.

---

Knowing about the different types of failures that can prevent your refrigerator water dispenser from working will help you determine the right corrective action to take.

Although you can fix some fridge water dispenser issues on your own, more complicated failures will require a visit from a technician.

When you need a technician to fix your refrigerator water dispenser, trust [Sears Home Services](/repair) to get the job done. We have experienced technicians that will get your dispenser fixed quickly and reliably.

---

Cooling issues affect the compressor, while dispenser problems are usually related to water flow or electrical controls.\",\"faqQuestion2\":\"How can I tell if the problem is my refrigerator or my home’s water supply?\",\"faqAnswer2\":\"An easy way to confirm this is by checking whether the ice maker is producing ice. No water flow indicates a household plumbing issue, while good flow points to a refrigerator component problem.\",\"faqQuestion3\":\"Can a frozen water line really stop the dispenser from working?\",\"faqAnswer3\":\"Yes.
